node.text:
It’s one of the world’s most treasured natural jewels, but the Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours. 
.
This is what the coal industry is doing to one of Australia's most remarkable natural wonders.
.
.
#greenpeace #reef #GBR #Australia #climatechange #globalwarming

node.title: Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours.

node.text:
Earlier this week, thousands of Indigenous Peoples marched to the Brazilian Congress to symbolically demarcate Brasília with 1,296 signs representing all the Indigenous Lands claimed by Indigenous Peoples in Brazil, in a protest against the government's refusal on demarcating Indigenous Lands.
Around 6,000 Indigenous Peoples have gathered this week at the Struggle for Life camp to fight for their lands and lives. 
.
.
.
.
#StruggleForLife #IndigenousEmergency #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Protest for the Demarcation of Indigenous Lands in Brazil

node.text:
More than 5,000 Indigenous leaders from all over the country are meeting at the #StruggleforLife camp in Brasilia this week to defend their rights against the anti-Indigenous agenda that advances in Brazil’s Congress and await a critical Supreme Court decision that will define the future for their lives, their lands and for the environmental conservation in Brazil. Forests thrive when Indigenous Rights are respected✊
.
.
.
.
#IndigenousEmergency #LutaPelaVida #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Struggle for Life Camp 2021 in Brasília, Brazil

node.text:
If the world is on fire, you don’t throw more fuel on it.

That’s what we’re doing by allowing the expansion of fossil fuel production.

How about a non-proliferation treaty... on fossil fuels?

via @fossilfueltreaty

#fossilfueltreaty #nonproliferation #fossilfuels #bigoil #oilcompanies #climateemergency #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #humanrights #climatejustice #solutions #coalphaseout #fossilfuelphaseout #energy #climate #climateaction

node.title: Towards a fossil fuel non-proliferation treaty?

node.text:
The Sámi people, the only existing Indigenous People in the EU, live in the northern part of what today is Scandinavia, Finland and Russia.

The Sámi community in Muonio is now fighting for their way of life. The Swedish state-owned forestry giant Sveaskog, is clearcutting huge areas in their lands, devastating traditional livelihoods, destroying biodiversity, and further eroding nature’s ability to combat climate change.

The community issued an ultimatum, demanding that Sveaskog stops ALL activities in the area, at least until proper consultation with the community. 

Will you help them to make Sveaskog listen? Tag @sveaskog  in the comments.

#sveaskog #sweden #scandinavia #forests #forestprotection #Sami #SamiPeople #IndigenousPeoples #landrights #humanrights #deforestation #forestdestruction #reindeerherding #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis

node.title: Stand with the Sámi for the forests!

node.text:
#floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.
.
But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.
How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming. Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take an immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.
.
.
.
#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #jakarta

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

node.text:
We know we need to rapidly move from oil and gas to renewable energy. But what happens to oil workers? 🤔 

At the moment, lots of people’s livelihoods are tied to polluting industries. Think oil and gas workers, aviation engineers, factory workers making petrol and diesel vehicles.

If we want to avoid catastrophic climate change, these polluting industries are going to have to change completely. Some of them will have to shrink. And these changes will impact the lives of these workers and their communities.

We have to move to an environmentally sustainable economy without leaving workers in polluting industries behind. Moving to a clean economy is a mammoth task that will also create millions of jobs around the world ⚖️🌍

We need governments to side with oil workers and the climate, not oil bosses 📢

Link in bio ☝️

#climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatejustice #socialjustice #fightinequality #energy #workers #protectworkers #livesbeforeprofits #oilworkers #gasworkers #rigged #greenpeace #greenpeaceuk #uk #documentary #justtransition #transition #greentransition #cleaneconomy #greenjobs #fossilfuels #greenrecovery #justrecovery #buildbackbetter

node.text:
Did you know that industrial agriculture accounts for as much greenhouse gas emissions as all global transportation combined?

So, reducing your meat and dairy consumption is not only good for your health, but it’s also good for the planet.

Starting this weekend, let’s challenge ourselves to consume more plant-based meals and demand companies and governments to protect forests and reduce the industrial production of meat and dairy.

🎥: @greenpeaceth
.
.
#LessMeatMoreVeg #greenpeace #climatechange

node.text:
Every year, hundreds of Cameroonians die or are left displaced due to flooding caused by blocked drainage. 

One of the culprits is plastic pollution. 

Cameroon produces 600,000 tonnes of plastic waste every year, the highest in Central Africa. Only 20 percent of this waste is recycled.

The global plastic crisis is out of hand and it’s society’s most vulnerable who end up bearing the brunt.

Help us make African governments vote in favour of a Global Plastic Treaty 📢 Link in bio ☝️

#BreakFreeFromPlastic #PlasticFreeJuly 

via @greenpeaceafrica

#douala #cameroon #floods #africa #greenpeaceafrica #greenpeace #plasticpollution #plastic #singleuseplastic #plasticbottles #extremeweather #climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatechange #globalplastictreaty

node.title: Devastating floods and plastic pollution in Douala, Cameroon

node.text:
Aurelie, a scientist from Mauritius and daughter of a fisherman, always felt a strong connection with the ocean.
.
Growing up by a beach she witnessed the unsustainable development affecting the ocean. Her life mission is to inspire future generations to protect the ocean, starting where land meets the sea.
.
@aurelie_hector @jake_letori
.
.
.
#VitalOceanVoices #ProtectTheOceans #IndianOcean #Mauritius #Madagascar #Seychelles #Oceans #Seas #Greenpeace

node.text:
The sea is rising higher and faster — floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.

But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.

How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming.

Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.

#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #Greenpeace #jakarta #taiwan #taipei #asia #globalwarming

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 04, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, people standing, outdoors and text that says '"Taking care of the Amazon today is not just taking care of us. It is taking care of everyone." -Nara Baré ARANDU'.

node.text: Indigenous Peoples hold the knowledge to live in harmony with the planet. Yet, their lives and rights continue to be threatened by greedy companies and governments who put profits over people. We must fight and stand in solidarity with Indigenous Peoples.

node.text:
A landmark vital to our all survival is disappearing silently — the Amazon rainforest (see link in bio), which is being destroyed at an alarming rate for industrial agriculture, logging and mining.
.
The rights of Indigenous Peoples and Traditional communities are critical to the health of the rainforest, but their lives and lands are under threat. Not only are we running out of time, but agribusiness interests are advancing radical laws in Brazil that would reward land grabbing, rob Indigenous Peoples of their lands, and accelerate forest destruction.
.
To win the fight against the health, climate and biodiversity crises we are in, we must stand in solidarity with Indigenous Peoples and stop the destruction of the Amazon.
.
Check the link in our bio to protect the Amazon!
.
.
.
#AllforAmazon #Amazon #rainforest #forests #Atomium #atomiumbrussels  #Brussels #Brussel #Bruxelles #Belgium #Belgique #belgie

node.text:
Extreme weather events are becoming more and more part of everyone’s lives. This is the result of years of climate denial and the fossil fuel industry’s lobbying against climate policies. Go to the link in our bio to read more.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#climatecrisis #climatechange #climatecrisis #newyork #nyc #flood⁣

node.text:
A landmark vital to our all survival is disappearing silently — the Amazon rainforest is being destroyed at an alarming rate for industrial agriculture, logging and mining.
(see link in bio).
.
The rights of Indigenous Peoples and Traditional communities are critical to the health of the rainforest, but their lives and lands are under threat. Not only are we running out of time, but agribusiness interests are advancing radical laws in Brazil that would reward land grabbing, rob Indigenous Peoples of their lands, and accelerate forest destruction.
.
To win the fight against the health, climate and biodiversity crises we are in, we must stand in solidarity with Indigenous Peoples and stop the destruction of the Amazon.
.
Check the link in our bio to protect the Amazon!
.
.
.
#AllforAmazon #Amazon #rainforest #forests #zaanseschans #zaanseschanswindmill  #Netherlands #Nederland

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 01, 2021. May be an image of body of water.

node.text:
Extreme weather events like Hurricane Ida are destroying cities, people’s homes, and lives around the world. 
.
Exactly 16 years to the day after Hurricane Katrina made landfall in Louisiana, the US state and Gulf Coast region again faced the onslaught of a hurricane. 
.
This is what the climate crisis looks like. 
.
Check the link in our bio to find resources to support the Gulf Coast from @anothergulf.ispossible 
.
We cannot allow companies and governments to continue putting profits over the lives of people and the planet. We need climate action NOW!
.
.
.
📸: 
1 - © Win McNamee/Getty Images
2 - © Scott Olson/Getty Images
3 - © Win McNamee/Getty Images
4 - © Brandon Bell/Getty Images

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of car and text that says '3 CITIES DRIVING CHANGE PHASING OUT GASOLINE, DIESEL, AND HYBRID CARS & ACCELERATING THE TRANSITION το ELECTRIC VEHICLES. വ 4 #DriveChange GREENPEACE'.

node.text:
What does a zero-carbon city look like? More and more cities around the world are driving change to offer its residents a cleaner and greener future. 

Phasing out gasoline/diesel and hybrid cars is one of the most important ways to reduce carbon emissions and clean up the air! 

Where do you live? Does your city have methods to reduce emissions and electrify? Share with us in the comments.

Also, let’s #DriveChange to ask multinational car brands to offer green mobility options for us! Check our link in bio for more info 👆
.
.
#mobility #cities #greencities #netzero #zeroemissions #EV #fossilfuels #greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of car and text that says '3 CITIES DRIVING CHANGE PHASING OUT GASOLINE, DIESEL, AND HYBRID CARS & ACCELERATING THE TRANSITION το ELECTRIC VEHICLES. വ 4 #DriveChange GREENPEACE'.

Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of sky and text that says '#DriveChange GREENPEACE Is Is your city ready to electrify and phase out gasoline, diesel, and hybrid cars?'.

Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of skyscraper and text that says 'Hong Kong GREENPEACE .Stop new registration of gasoline and hybrid vehicles by 2035. •Add 155,000 charging units by 2025. •Use electric vehicles forall government-use vehicles. Subsidize up to USD $37K for replacing an old fossil fuel car with a battery electric vehicle. #DriveChange'.

Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Oslo GREENPEACE Over O 50% of new cars sold are electric vehicles (EVs). It's so far the biggest percentage among all cities globally. •All vehicles sold by 2025 will be zero-emission vehicles in Norway. #DriveChange'.

Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of monument and text that says 'Paris GREENPEACE Ban diesel vehicles by 2024; no gasoline vehicles by 2030. On annua "Car Free Day" the city center is reserved for pedestrians and public transport users only. Introduced low emission zone. #DriveChange'.
Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on August 31, 2021. May be an image of coast, ocean and text that says 'Greenpeace Lorenzo Moscia'.

node.text:
Our oceans are vast and awe-inspiring and full of wonders yet they’re under constant threat from warming temperatures to destructive industries looking to exploit their resources. They need a strong Global Ocean Treaty to protect them and all that depend on them💙 
Check the link in our bio to join the movement ✊
.
How do you love the ocean? Share with us in comments👇

node.text:
A landmark vital to our all survival is disappearing silently — the Amazon rainforest.
.
The Amazon is being destroyed at an alarming rate for industrial agriculture, logging and mining.
.
The rights of Indigenous Peoples and Traditional communities are critical to the health of the rainforest, but their lives and lands are under threat. Not only are we running out of time, but agribusiness interests are advancing radical laws in Brazil that would reward land grabbing, rob Indigenous Peoples of their lands, and accelerate forest destruction.
.
To win the fight against the health, climate and biodiversity crises we are in, we must stand in solidarity with Indigenous Peoples and stop the destruction of the Amazon.
.
Check the link in our bio to protect the Amazon!
.
.
.
#AllforAmazon #Amazon #rainforest #forests #Germany #Berlin #brandenburgertor #brandeburggate

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 in Victoria Harbor, Hong Kong.

node.text:
In Hong Kong, around 200 tonnes of plastic tableware are thrown away each day, and this number is increasing every year.

The government is now launching a public consultation a new plan, Regulation of Disposable Plastic Tableware. Under the first stage of this plan, disposable expanded polystyrene (EPS) tableware will be prohibited from offering or retail-selling, and the restaurants will be prohibited from offering plastic cutlery, straws, stirrers and plates for dine-in service. 

During the second phase - which currently lacks a concrete timeline – plastic cups, cup lids, food containers and food container covers will be prohibited. @greenpeace_hk demands a ban on the use of disposable plastic tableware before 2025 and urges the public to voice out their support. The beautiful Victoria Harbour must be protected from the terrifying plastic pollution like in this fictional but thought-provoking image.

🎨 credit: @surrealhk 
.
.
#greenpeace #plastic #plasticfree #plasticpollution
